DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Study Sponsor Biopsy Specimen Not Sent Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text to describe why a biopsy specimen acquired from a patient was not sent to the clinical study sponsor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Study Sponsor Biopsy Specimen Not Sent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]_A specimen obtained by biopsy, which is a process of removing tissue from living patients for diagnostic examination._To take, accept, or get something offered._Cause or enable to go or be conveyed or transmitted._A person or organization that supports or champions something._A specimen obtained by biopsy, which is a process of removing tissue from living patients for diagnostic examination._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Cause or enable to go or be conveyed or transmitted.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person or organization that supports or champions something.:A specimen obtained by biopsy, which is a process of removing tissue from living patients for diagnostic examination.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Abbreviated or shortened text field to describe an activity, topic, or item.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Having little (physical) length or seeming to be limited in (temporal) duration.
